articles.description: The National Eating Disorders Association said its helpline has seen a 40% increase in contact since March 2020.
articles.content: Like many essential employees, Jessica, a grocery worker and graduate student in Atlanta, has been "extremely overworked" during the coronavirus pandemic. Overwhelmed by stress, she's fallen back int… [+8944 chars]

articles.author: Deborah Fuller
articles.title: An expert answers 3 questions on COVID-19 vaccines, variants - World Economic Forum
articles.description: Vaccination reduces the chance of getting seriously ill with COVID-19, says microbiologist Deborah Fuller. She answers three questions on vaccines and variants.
articles.content:
• As COVID-19 immunisation continues across the world, many people are still unclear as to what vaccines mean for transmission.

articles.author: Lauren Mascarenhas and Zamira Rahim, CNN
articles.title: Covid-19 death rates 10 times higher in countries where most adults are overweight, report finds - CNN
articles.description: The risk of death from Covid-19 is about 10 times higher in countries where more than half of the population is overweight, according to a report released Wednesday by the World Obesity Forum.

articles.author: Dr. Marc Siegel, Opinion columnist
articles.title: What does COVID immunity get me? Not much. The government should catch up to science. - Yahoo! Voices
articles.description: Vaccination or proof of immunity from COVID infection has been a ticket to reopening Israeli society. Why aren't we following that model in America?
articles.content: You use it to brew your coffee, make your kid's mac and cheese, and even soak in it with some bubbles after a long day. You assume your tap water is perfectly healthy becausearen't there regulations … [+38868 chars]
